pr_title: ISPN-12141 Doc updates from downstream review

timeline.bodyText: since you changed the example, I would add a link to DefaultTemplate javadoc. So, the user knows which templates are available.
timeline.author: pruivo

timeline.bodyText: is BYTEA a valid type? (honest question, I don't know the available SQL types :))
timeline.author: pruivo
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -15,19 +15,19 @@ configuration of your cache configuration, as in the following example:
 
 [source,xml,options="nowrap",subs=attributes+]
 ----
-<distributed-cache-configuration name="persistent-cache">
+<distributed-cache-configuration name="persistent-cache" xmlns:jdbc="urn:infinispan:config:store:jdbc:{schemaversion}">
     <persistence>
-        <string-keyed-jdbc-store>
-            <data-source jndi-url="jdbc/datasource"/> <1>
-            <string-keyed-table drop-on-exit="true"
+        <jdbc:string-keyed-jdbc-store>
+            <jdbc:data-source jndi-url="jdbc/postgres"/>
+            <jdbc:string-keyed-table drop-on-exit="true"
                           create-on-start="true"
                           prefix="TBL">
-                <id-column name="ID" type="VARCHAR(255)"/>
-                <data-column name="DATA" type="BINARY"/>
-                <timestamp-column name="TS" type="BIGINT"/>
-                <segment-column name="S" type="INT"/>
-            </string-keyed-table>
-        </string-keyed-jdbc-store>
+                <jdbc:id-column name="ID" type="VARCHAR(255)"/>
+                <jdbc:data-column name="DATA" type="BYTEA"/>

replies.bodyText:
@pruivo yeah I believe it is. https://www.postgresql.org/docs/7.2/datatype-binary.html
I'm not the expert here though. I'll double check this with Gustavo to be sure.
replies.author: oraNod

replies.bodyText:
@oraNod @pruivo depends on the database.
For the data column type we have:
postgres: BYTEA
mysql, mariadb, mssql: VARBINARY
db2: blob
oracle: raw
sybase: image
replies.author: gustavolira

timeline.message: fix ambiguity for force return flag

timeline.bodyText:
what about replacing "this page" with "the contributing guide"?
please refer to this page. vs  please refer to the contribution guide
WDYT?

 If you need help with cloning, compiling or setting the project up in an IDE please refer to
